story:
Once upon a time, in a land far, far away, there was a kind and curious little boy named Timmy. Timmy lived in a small, cozy house at the edge of a vast, enchanted forest. He loved to explore the forest, discovering new and wonderful things every day.

One day, as Timmy was wandering through the forest, he came across a tiny, frightened mouse. The mouse was trapped in a thicket of thorns, and no matter how hard it struggled, it couldn't free itself.

Timmy knew he had to help the mouse, so he carefully made his way through the thorns, being careful not to prick himself. When he reached the mouse, he gently picked it up and carried it out of the thicket, setting it down on a soft patch of grass.

The mouse was so grateful to Timmy for saving its life that it offered to grant him a wish. Timmy thought for a moment, and then he said, "I wish that I could understand and speak the language of all the animals in the forest."

The mouse nodded its head, and with a wave of its paw, it granted Timmy's wish. From that moment on, Timmy could understand and speak the language of every animal in the forest.

He spent his days talking to the birds, chatting with the squirrels, and even having deep conversations with the wise old owls. He learned so much from the animals, and they all became his dear friends.

But Timmy knew that there was one animal in particular that he wanted to speak to more than any other. It was the great, majestic lion that ruled over the forest. The lion was feared by all, but Timmy knew that deep down, it was kind and just.

One day, Timmy worked up the courage to approach the lion. He bowed low before the mighty beast and said, "Hello, great lion. I am Timmy, a friend to all the animals of the forest. I am honored to be in your presence."

The lion looked down at Timmy and smiled. "I have heard of you, Timmy," it said. "You are the kind and brave boy who save the little mouse from the thicket of thorns. You have a good heart, and I am pleased to meet you."

Timmy and the lion became the best of friends, and Timmy learned more from the lion than he ever could have imagined. He learned about courage, strength, and leadership, and he was forever grateful for the gift of understanding the language of the animals.

And so, Timmy lived happily ever after, surrounded by his dear friends in the enchanted forest. And every night, as he drifted off to sleep, he would smile and thank the little mouse for granting him the greatest wish he could ever have imagined.

The end.

Good night my dear son, I hope you enjoyed the story and have sweet dreams.
